definition: to manipulate from behind the scenes/to pull the strings
curtain or screen/canopy or tent/headquarters of a general/act (of a play)
to grasp/to hold/to operate/to manage/to control/to steer/to exercise/to drill (practice)/to play/to speak (a language)
warp (the vertical threads in weaving)/vertical/longitudinal/north-south (lines of longitude)/lengthwise/to release/to indulge/even if

sentences.english: Perhaps he is afraid to speak on any topic at all without Dick Cheney pulling his strings.
sentences.chinese: 大概没有迪克切尼的幕后操纵他害怕谈论任何话题。

sentences.english: Chance is the stage-manager of such conversations.
sentences.chinese: 偶然是这种交谈的幕后操纵者。

sentences.english: Lee Kuan Yew still likes to jerk the strings backstage in Singapore.
sentences.chinese: 新加坡的李光耀依然喜欢在幕后操纵大局。

sentences.english: The police are hot on the trailof the mastermind behind the bank robbery.
sentences.chinese: 警察很快就要找到银行抢劫案的幕后操纵者了。

definition: malign agent who manipulates from behind the scenes/hidden hand
to incite/to prompt (sb to do sth)
malign agent who manipulates from behind the scenes/hidden hand/(Tw) mechanic/blue-collar worker/manual laborer
lit. to hide the sky with one hand/to hide the truth from the masses
in the dark/in secret/on the sly/surreptitiously
to collude with/to collaborate with/to gang up with
